name: Flows
title: Flows
body:

Authentication

Code Flow


title Authentication Code Flow - EFS Admin <> IdP
 
participant User (Browser)
participant IdP
participant EFS
 
 
note right of EFS: application secret is set
User (Browser)->EFS: Enter landing page
EFS->User (Browser): Redirect to IdP
User (Browser)->IdP: Follow Redirect
IdP->User (Browser):  Show login page
User (Browser)->IdP: Enter login credentials, click login
IdP->+IdP: Validate credentials
IdP->User (Browser): Redirect back with Code and send master session cookie
User (Browser)->EFS: Follow Redirect
EFS->IdP: Use code and application secret to ask for Access and Refresh token
IdP->+EFS: Access and refresh token
EFS->EFS: Validate access token
EFS->EFS: Store access and refresh token
EFS->EFS: Request user existance and authorization
 
alt authorized and exists
EFS->User (Browser): Show admin landing page and send session cookie
else not authorized or not exists
EFS->User (Browser): Show Error page




Implicit Flow


title Authentication Implicit Flow - Portals <> IdP
  
participant User (Browser)
participant IdP
participant Portals Frontend
  
  
note right of Portals Frontend: no application secret needed
User (Browser)->Portals Frontend: Enter landing page
Portals Frontend->User (Browser): Store current hash/query status
Portals Frontend->User (Browser): Redirect to IdP
User (Browser)->IdP: Follow Redirect
IdP->User (Browser):  Show login page
User (Browser)->IdP: Enter login credentials, click login
IdP->+IdP: Validate credentials
IdP->User (Browser): Redirect back with ID and access token in hash
User (Browser)->Portals Frontend: Follow Redirect
Portals Frontend->User (Browser): Store ID and access token
Portals Frontend->User (Browser): Restore hash/query state
alt authorized and exists
Portals Frontend->User (Browser): Show portal private home
else not authorized or not exists
Portals Frontend->User (Browser): Show Error page




Session Management


title Session Management - EFS Admin <> IdP
 
participant User (Browser)
participant IdP
participant EFS
 
 
note right of EFS: User is logged in, server has refresh-token
User (Browser)->EFS: User triggers any route at EFS
note right of EFS: Session lifetime is about to expire
EFS->IdP: request a new access token using the refresh-token
alt Refresh token is valid
IdP->EFS: send new access token
EFS->EFS: validate access token
EFS->EFS: Store access token and renew session
EFS->User (Browser): respond to the triggered action
else Refresh token expired
EFS->EFS: remove session
EFS->User (Browser): redirect user to IdP
note left of User (Browser): start with authentication
end


Logout


title Logout - EFS Admin <> IdP
 
participant User (Browser)
participant IdP
participant EFS
 
 
note right of EFS: User is logged in
User (Browser)->EFS: User triggers logout
EFS->EFS: Remove local session
EFS->User (Browser): Redirect user to IdP logout
User (Browser)->IdP: Follow Redirect
IdP->IdP: Remove master session
IdP->User (Browser): Redirect user back to installation
User (Browser)->EFS: Follow redirect
EFS->User (Browser): Show logout/login page

Create new EFS account user



title Sync data on create EFS user account

participant EFS
participant IdP


note right of EFS: user is logged in and has access rights to create user
EFS->EFS: Admin user opens "create user account" page
EFS->EFS: Admin user enters new account user information \n (user name, first name, name, email and other necessary information) 
EFS->EFS: Admin clicks save 
EFS->EFS: new entry in users table
EFS->IdP: GET request to /api/v1/users/[email address]
IdP->IdP: Checks if entry exists
IdP->EFS: Send response
note right of IdP: {email, firstName, lastName}
alt
EFS->EFS: Response user: use insert()
EFS->IdP: POST request to /api/v1/users?activate=true
IdP->IdP: Creates new IdP entry
else
EFS->EFS: Response user: use update()
EFS->IdP: POST request to /api/v1/users/[oktaId]
IdP->IdP: Update IdP entry
end
note right of IdP: {\n id: string unique identifier, \n profile: { \n     email: string email, \n     login: string email, \n     firstName: string firstName, \n     lastName: string lastName \n }\n}
note right of IdP: @see https://developer.okta.com/docs/reference/api/users/#response-example-10
IdP->EFS: Send Response
alt
EFS->EFS: create entry in iam_user_reference table
else
EFS->EFS: update entry in iam_user_reference table
end
EFS->EFS: show successfully created


Update existing EFS user account


Info

POST request is used to update incremental

https://developer.okta.com/docs/reference/api/users/#update-user


title Sync data on update EFS user account

participant EFS
participant IdP


note right of EFS: user is logged in and has access rights to update user
EFS->EFS: Admin user opens user entry and opens "change user data" page
EFS->EFS: Admin user changes user information \n (first name, name) 
EFS->EFS: Admin clicks save 
EFS->EFS: entry is updated in users table
EFS->EFS: receives uuid for oktaId from iam_user_reference_table
EFS->EFS: use update()
EFS->IdP: POST request to /api/v1/users/[oktaId] with changed data
IdP->IdP: Update IdP entry
note right of IdP: {\n id: string unique identifier, \n profile: { \n     email: string email, \n     login: string email, \n     firstName: string firstName, \n     lastName: string lastName \n }\n}
note right of IdP: @see https://developer.okta.com/docs/reference/api/users/#response-example-10
IdP->EFS: Send Response
EFS->EFS: update updated_at in iam_user_reference table
EFS->EFS: show successfully updated


Create Portal


title Create Portal and receive client_id from IdP

participant Portalsadmin
participant IdP

note right of Portalsadmin: user is logged in and has access rights to create portals
Portalsadmin-->Portalsadmin: create new portal
Portalsadmin-->IdP: create application with active=true
IdP-->Portalsadmin: send client_id
Portalsadmin-->IdP: add to group
IdP-->Portalsadmin: send response
Portalsadmin-->IdP: create trusted origin
IdP-->Portalsadmin: send response
note right of Portalsadmin: in case of existing, catch Exception and ignore
Portalsadmin-->Portalsadmin: create entry in iam_portal_settings


Assign Participant to Portal



title Assign Participant to Portal

participant Portalsadmin
participant IdP

note right of Portalsadmin: user is logged in and has access rights to invite participiants portals
Portalsadmin-->Portalsadmin: open newly created portal
Portalsadmin-->Portalsadmin: open participant section
Portalsadmin-->Portalsadmin: select participant(s) to invite and invite participant(s)
Portalsadmin-->IdP: get user by email
alt
IdP-->Portalsadmin: no result
Portalsadmin-->IdP: create user
IdP-->Portalsadmin: send UserModel
Portalsadmin-->Portalsadmin: create entry in iam_portals_user_referenc
else
IdP-->Portalsadmin: send UserModel
Portalsadmin-->Portalsadmin: create entry in iam_portals_user_referenc
end


Sign in to portal

title Portal login

participant PortalFe
participant PortalBe
participant IdP
participant AD

PortalFe-->PortalFe: open http(s)://www.example.com/portals/portal-n
PortalFe-->PortalBe: receive portal configuration by portalId
alt:
PortalBe-->PortalFe: send Status Code 444 (iam_module_active=false)
PortalFe-->PortalBe: follow usual flow
PortalBe-->PortalFe: login
else:
PortalBe-->PortalFe: send portal configuration object
PortalFe-->IdP: redirect to
IdP-->IdP: LoginProcess by user
alt:
note right of IdP: user exists and has access rights
IdP-->AD: prompt password
AD-->AD: sign in
AD-->IdP: send status
IdP-->IdP: create session
IdP-->PortalFe: redirect with id_token and access_token
PortalFe-->PortalBe: post data to /api/iam/auth/signIn
PortalBe-->PortalBe: get identity from id_token and access_token
PortalBe-->PortalBe: check in portal_users_reference
alt:
PortalBe-->PortalFe: user not exists
else:
PortalBe-->PortalBe: create X-Authorization token
PortalBe-->PortalBe: create local session
PortalBe-->PortalFe: send header and payload
PortalFe-->PortalFe: show screen after logged in
end:
else:
note right of IdP: user does not exists or has no access rights
AD-->IdP: send status
IdP-->IdP: show login screen
end:
end:
